Again, as he had shown Nightstrike, Tucson was NOT as slow as he appeared. =
The mere hum of the beams comming from the weapon quickly strike his audio =
sensors, and again, performs an impressive back flip, which allows the beam=
s to travel beneath him.  At the same time, he performs the cross bow trick=
, and manages to quickly get a sonar signal right to the Predacon's weapon,=
 thus giving him a viable target to fire his arrow, which now strikes the b=
arrel of the weapon.

" Nice try."

Deception was another one of his attrib=
utes.  He made them assume he was unarmed, when the weapon he holds was rea=
lly subspaced behind him the entire time.  Yet after he lands he does not s=
tay still.  On surprisingly light feet, even as painful as his injured foot=
 was, he barely touches the floor long enough before executing an impressiv=
e display of acrobatics, as he now gets behind the predacon who had shot at=
 him, quickly performing a perfect front sweep.  He utters no sound while p=
erforming his actions.

"Have a nice trip."

 <airly2002@...> wrote:
>

> 
> "Well well well"Said mockly the =
Predacon while he aimed with his blaster "you are quite stupid or Brave to =
came to hydra's lair, unarmed and alone it seems... It's a pity that you wo=
nt get out here alive"
>

agains Tucson

Fortress

>   
> Tucson had to think and move quickly which was not ve=
ry easy for him due to his injury. Still, in the same vicinity as Scourge, =
Cyclonus and Rodimus, he manages to keep himself out of sight, using the sk=
ills which had been taught to him by Prowl. Quietly he stands up against a =
wall in a dark crevace of the room, making no sound. He thinks for just a m=
oment at how cowardice this must seem. To try and make a move and then rece=
de into darkness like a spinless glitch. That he was not. He could feel the=
 hold Cyclonus had over Rodimus and it enrages him to the point where he gr=
ips his fists in anger. He thinks to himself.
> 
> " I've come this far, I =
just can't give up and turn the other way. Rodimus, whether he knows it or =
not, needs my help. But how to go about this? This is something Kup nor Pro=
wl trained me to do."
> 
> He puts his hand on his chest. His actions were =
of his spark, not of his mind. His spark was telling him to continue on and=
 not give up. 
> He remembers the good days when Rodimus was very close to =
all his Autobot comrades, and how many battles were won thanks to him and h=
is guidence. And now, it appeared that Rodimus was the one who needed to be=
 rescued. He closes his eyes in thought.
> 
> " Optimus Prime, what would y=
ou have done if you were in my position? If there were a time when I needed=
 your guidence, it's now. Rodimus needs me but how? How can I pull this off=
? I'm just one Autobot with only his bare spark leading him..." 
> 
> In th=
ought he tries to go back to a time, when he had met Optimus Prime as a you=
ng rookie in training. He flashes back to one particular moment when he act=
ually got the opportunity to talk to the great Autobot leader. He remembers=
 how he was told that no matter how dim a situation was, there was always a=
 light to guide them through. It comes to him, the very verse Rodimus had s=
aid when he first took up the Matrix of Leadership.
> 
> "Light our Darkest=
 Hour." He thinks to himself at first.
> 
> "That's it. That's what Optimus=
 Prime would have done. But instead of the Matrix it's up to ME to light ou=
r darkest hour. Of course, I awoke first, it must mean something. All right=
, Tucson get off your sorry aft and make this happen."
> 
> He gathers the =
strength to walk into where he could be seen, judging by the heat that ligh=
ts were giving off, as faint as the lights may be. He stands before Cyclonu=
s, and Scourge unarmed, yet ready to defend himself if need be.
> 
> " Yes,=
 you do have someone here. And that someone is me. I don't know if you reme=
mber me or not, we may not have even met. My name is Tucson and I'm proud t=
o say that I am a member of the Autobot faction." 
> 
> He then senses Rodi=
mus not too far away.
> 
> " All right, Rodimus, I have a question for you,=
 and you may answer at will. What was the very verse that brought the Matri=
x of Leadership to life, thus giving you the power of its spark? I know you=
 know this, and right now you may be hating my sorry servos, but I think I =
could use a refresher on what it was. Can you tell me?"
> 
> He was now pre=
paring himself to get the bolts beaten out of him. This would either make o=
r break things. It was a heck of a gamble yet Tucson knew it was his greate=
st Trump Card and he was not afraid to use it. 
>

> > As Hydras' extended=
 his invitation to Cyclonus, and Scourge, Rodimus was surprised for a momen=
t, but then just leaned back against a support beam, his arms once again fo=
lded across his chest. He was about to say some thing really clever about t=
his when he thought he heard something . . . 
> > 
> > >"Rodimus."
> > 
> >=
 Dark Rodimus jerked up. He was not sure what he heard, but it sounded like=
 some sort of ghostly whisper of his name. He glanced around . . . 
> > 
> =
> "What was that?!" Scourge said, instantly on the alert, his hyper keen se=
nses also keying in on the strange whisper. He whipped his disintergration =
rifle out and began to look around, his optics narrow and watchful. 
> > 
>=
 > "What was what?" Cyclonus said, obviously unaware of the whisper, but he=
 too grew more watchful, trusting Scourge's senses. 
> > 
> > >"This is Per=
ceptor, We may have a posible intruder..." The Sgurity
> > > Drones are rel=
eased to start a search party"
> > 
> > "An intruder" Scourge almost hissed=
 as he began to move around the room, his weapon was once again drawn and r=
eady. 
> > 
> > Rodimus, his quarrel with Cyclonus and Scourge all but forg=
otten as this new situation developed had already drawn his weapon as well.=
 There would be time enough for thier fight once this was over. 
> > 
> > "=
What is it?" Rodimus said, his voice tense but ready.
> > 
> > Scourge grun=
ted, "I had it. It smelled like an Autobot" Scourge continued to prowl arou=
nd the room, his optics glowing as he probed different areas.
> > 
> > "Ahh=
hh . . ." Scourge squated down to run two fingers on the ground and hold it=
 to his nose, " . . . But he was here." Scourge chuckled darkly. "And we sh=
all find him, yes we shall, we have prey." 
> > 
> > > Hydras when he heard=
 his security chief warning said "Every one take 
> > > a search PArty and =
seek every inch of this base"
> > 
> > Cyclonus nodded as he watched, "Hydr=
as, I shall help coordinate the seaerh from here."
> > 
> > Dark Rodimus gl=
anced back at Hydras and then at Scourge and Cyclonus, "And I'm going to ca=
tch that intruder!" His voice all business now. "Whatever it is we're going=
 to catch it, and dismantle it . . ." Rodimus energized his weapon, " . . .=
 The HARD way!"
> > 
> > Scourge stood up saying nothing, looking off in th=
e direction that his powerful tracking sensors told him were small droplets=
 of lubricant, and his quarry. With smooth and whisper silent strides he to=
ok off at a jog, followed quickly and somewhat more loudly by Rodimus!
